content:
I am finding the tooltips get in the way more than they help, obscuring what I'm writing or inspecting via Infoview.

Is it possible to turn them off in VSC and the live.lean-lang.org environment?

It would be nice to have a button - eg Shift - you press to bring up a tooltip, and it goes away when you stop pressing Shift.
(and maybe Cntrl to make them stay even when you unpress it, and go away when you press it again).

Currently the massive tooltips obscure the content.

example:

Screenshot 2024-12-17 at 19.58.00.png

I once had the GitLens extension with hovers enabled and then it seemed that wherever I put my cursor on the screen in a Lean file I'd get a huge hover -- I'd move the cursor to remove the hover and just get another one :-) . Nowadays I'm just used to moving my cursor away from the screen if I don't want a hover.

The 'Editor: Hover' and 'Infoview: Show Tooltip On Hover' settings control whether hovers pop up automatically. You can still bring up InfoView hovers manually by clicking on the term and VS Code hovers with the Ctrl+K Ctrl+I chord.
I've added a request on their github: https://github.com/leanprover/vscode-lean4/issues/559

VS Code hovers are enabled by default in VS Code and vscode-lean4 won't change that default setting for all users. InfoView hovers will remain enabled by default for UX consistency with VS Code. Your preferences for UX are not necessarily what everyone else prefers.

Marc Huisinga said:

Your preferences for UX are not necessarily what everyone else prefers.

I wonder if this opinion is based on evidence?

Also, you misunderstand. The suggestion does not change any behaviour - except for those that configure it to do so.

All Marc needs is for one person to like hover, and then this is a proof that not everyone prefers what you want. And perhaps Marc likes hover himself, in which case he has a rock solid proof that his claim is correct, which is better than evidence.

I was thinking something similar Kevin :)

Anyway I won't pursue this - I've rarely had a good experience suggesting things on open source project githubs going back years.

It's similar to stack exchange - a terrible experience.

This site however has been extremely helpful.
Yeah this site is great because it's so quick and interactive
I think the people on it are much nicer !

I think the critical piece is that one can configure VSCode to change the behavior already, either globally across all workspaces, or for a particular workspace:

Users that dislike this default behavior can change it using the 'Editor: Hover' and 'Infoview: Show Tooltip On Hover' settings and configure their preferred keyboard shortcut for editor hovers by setting the 'Show or Focus Hover' shortcut (default:Â Ctrl+K Ctrl+I) in VS Code's keyboard shortcut settings.

I'm curious, @rzeta0, what do you think of that approach?

(deleted)

I tried the cntrl-k and cntrl-i idea and (1) it is too many keypresses, and (2) it breaks the fluidity of just pressing something like shift to enable them only for the duration of pressing shift.

If that can be made to work with the existing shortcuts framework - problem solved!
I think you should be able to change the 'Show or Focus Hover' shortcut
I cant' seem to find this particular setting. I've tried Show or Focus Hover in the search box for settings but nothing, where this search did work for the hover on/off setting.
It's in the keyboard shortcuts screen (File -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts)
rzeta0 has marked this topic as resolved.
